item.title: House of the Arsenal (Maison de l’Arsenal)
item.description: Province Gallia Location DIVODURUM MEDIOMATRICORUM (Metz, France) DIVODURUM MEDIOMATRICORUM (Pleiades) Sublocation Description In the valley of the Moselle, Divodurum Mediomatricorum, a former Gallic oppidum on the hill of Ste-Croix, became an urban center in the Augustan period. It had an amphitheater, an aqueduct, several baths, and a sewer network with a large collector. Garden HHouse of the Arsenal (Maison de l’Arsenal) Keywords courtyard porticoes hypocausts Garden Description A large house (40 x 40 m) of the second century covered the site of three adjacent buildings going back to the years 60-80 (Fig 1). It was built around a central courtyard [1] 18 meters on a side, bordered by porticos on the east, south, and west. The courtyard, doubtless treated as a garden, had a rectangular pool that has been partially excavated. On the axis of the pool, on the north side and seemingly opening directly onto the courtyard was a large, 60-square-meter room [2] heated by hypocausts.
